It can’t find the variables because they haven’t been declared…

item.title: Why is this unable to find the variable?
item.dc:creator: @Gamerstips Gamerstips
item.description:
@Gamerstips wrote:

These are the errors i get when i compile.

client.java:1604: cannot find symbol     symbol  : variable txt4                  location: class client                       txt4 = msg;                              ^                                    client.java:1605: cannot find symbol     symbol  : variable string4UpdateRequired location: class client                       string4UpdateRequired = true;            ^                                    client.java:15956: cannot find symbol    symbol  : variable txt4                  location: class client                       txt4 = forceMsg;                         ^                                    client.java:15957: cannot find symbol    symbol  : variable string4UpdateRequired location: class client                       string4UpdateRequired = true;            ^                                    4 errors                                 Press any key to continue . . .

this is my public void say(string what, string msg) {

public void say(String what, String msg){ txt4 = msg; string4UpdateRequired = true; updateRequired = true; plrText = what; plrTextUpdateRequired = true; }

this is my completesay:

public void completeSay() { txt4 = forceMsg; string4UpdateRequired = true; updateRequired = true; //sM("Completed Say."); }

This is the tut i followed http://silabsoft.org/smf/index.php?showtopic=1832

Read full topic
item.source: Why is this unable to find the variable?
